page.title: 12TRANSPORT.
page.content: In the past the railway and the canal played an important part in the life of the town. Nowadays{transport}is concentrated on the road network, the rail links and the canal being primarily for leisure use rather than {industry}.An indication of the decline of the use of the railway is shown by the number of trains which, though travelling through Congleton, no longer stop there. The function of the railway has been transformed from that of industrial link to passenger service for Congleton people who wish to work or shop in larger towns such as Stoke on Trent or Manchester.
